wiki.content: "Better Man" is a song by American alternative rock group Pearl Jam which rocks from their 1994 album Vitalogy. It was a major hit on American rock, alternative and pop radio. Since the band did not release it as a retail single in the United States, it was inelligible for the Billboard Hot 100 due to the rules at the time. Nonetheless, it was one of the band's biggest pop radio hits - second only to "Last Kiss" - hitting #13 on Billboard's Pop Radio Airplay chart, along with hitting #1 on the Mainstream Rock Tracks chart and #2 on the Modern Rock Tracks chart. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Better Man" is a song by American alternative rock group Pearl Jam which rocks from their 1994 album Vitalogy. It was a major hit on American rock, alternative and pop radio. Since the band did not release it as a retail single in the United States, it was inelligible for the Billboard Hot 100 due to the rules at the time. Nonetheless, it was one of the band's biggest pop radio hits - second only to "Last Kiss" - hitting #13 on Billboard's Pop Radio Airplay chart, along with hitting #1 on the Mainstream Rock Tracks chart and #2 on the Modern Rock Tracks chart.

track.name: Better Man
comments: Will never get tired of this song.
Pearl Jam were never better than this.
Take me back to1993 please
I remember listening to this song in a documentary about physical abuse in high school. When asked our thoughts about the movie, the only thing we talked about was how much we loved Pearl Jam...
MY ALL-TIME FAVORITE SONG OF PJ
can't find a better baaaaaand!!!
Catchy and uplifting song, but I've always felt like it never really "grew" as much as it should. Like, I don't know, it just feels like the song could have been longer
I prefer the slow Flock Rock Demo to the Fast Rock Version.
can't find a better maaaaaaaan!
does anybody know the name of the song in which eddie talks about saying goodbye or something and in the end he ends up in bar and orders a drink haha
black, the best for mi.

http://issuu.com/rockaxxess/docs/decjan12-13 something for Polish fans - nowy numer ROCK AXXESS miedzy innymi z małym przeglądem dyskografii Pearl Jam ;) / the PJ article is in Polish only but most of the rest are also in English so you might want to check out the magazine anyway ;)
Cool.
rock on
Mindblowing! <3
sweet jam!!!
Never gets old. NEVER. [2]
This song is far too short. That ending jam always feels like it ends about 20 minutes before it should!

She loved him, yeah, she don't want to leave this way
She needs him, yeah that's why she'll be back again
Can't find a better man, can't find a better man.
MASTERPIECE! [2]
